results.title: Senior Software Engineer (Full-Stack)
results.description:
Company Description

Hi! We‚Äôre so happy that you‚Äôre here.

Think-it is a software engineering collective on a mission to unlock human potential through sustainable use of technology. Our high-performance, low-carbon solutions help innovative teams around the world lower costs, democratize data, and reach net-zero faster.
With a focus on digital transformation, smart infrastructure, and the UN SDGs, we tackle meaningful problems that can only be solved with future-proof technology. Our team includes experts in DevOps and Cloud, Data Science and Data Engineering, and Web and Mobile Development..
Founded in 2017, Think-it is home to a diverse community of changemakers ‚Äî we represent 8+ nationalities, and 40% of us are women. We‚Äôre proud to be backed by mission-aligned partners, and our goals are people- and planet-centric.

¬†

Job Description

The Challenge

We believe that technology is most powerful when it's used to build real solutions to the ways we live, move, eat, and work on this planet. Our cross-discipline teams tackle big and diverse challenges with partners around the world, and no two projects are alike - but the backbone of any successful team is a Software Engineer.

We‚Äôre looking for a Software Engineer with 3-5 years of experience working on Web and Mobile development, and anything it takes to solve problems and delight users both internally and externally for our partner projects.

80%: Your key responsibilities

  • Build across the full stack from the backend APIs to mobile and web front end-user interfaces to deliver end-to-end solutions based on user requirements and objectives
  • Advocate for design thinking and user empathy to design and deliver high-quality UX
  • Build reusable, scalable, and reliable software solutions.
  • Build technical documentation for partner projects, and contribute to Think-it's internal knowledge and codebases
  • Build technical documentation for our learning platform, and contribute to Think-it's internal knowledge and codebases

20%: Up to you!
What are you passionate about? What do you want to learn, and where else would you like to contribute?

Requirements

What we‚Äôre looking for
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience as a Full Stack Software Engineer, including experience designing and building complex web application architectures with reliability, high-availability, performance, and scalability
  • Strong focus on Frontend web development and technologies including experience working with standard frontend frameworks like React, Angular and VueJs - and experience designing Web UI and UX
  • Experience in debugging, testing, and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with Agile Software Development Techniques and Tools, TDD, and pair programming
  • Professional written and verbal fluency in English
Who you are
  • You are self-motivated. You take initiative, are naturally curious, and can learn new things quickly while continuing to deliver value on the job.
  • You are a shipper. You respect deadlines, accomplish your work autonomously, and have experience setting a positive example for self-management to your team members.
  • You are people-centric. You have the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts, and enjoy helping others grow.
It would be great if you also have:
  • B.Sc or M.Sc in Computer Science or similar technical discipline
  • Experience organizing workshops, bootcamps, developer groups, or forums
  • Experience working with standard cloud services provider (preferably AWS or GCP)
  • Experience working with international and/or distributed teams
  • Experience in mobile development (iOS and/or Android)
  • Professional proficiency in additional languages like French and Tunisian Arabic

Benefits

What we offer you:
  • Competitive monthly salary
  • Autonomous and remote-friendly workplace culture
  • Globally conscious culture invested in the ethical use of technology to solve real problems
  • Free weekly team lunches
  • Team activities, retreats, and reflections
  • Peer-to-peer learning and development
  • A lifetime community of like-minded changemakers

Think-it is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, veteran status, disability, history of disability, or perceived disability.

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Who We Are

PushBlack is the nation's largest media advocacy organization for Black Americans, currently serving 9 million people monthly across all platforms. We use the power of narrative, especially Black History, to educate and activate our subscribers to build their personal power and create lasting economic and political change.

In 2021, PushBlack grew to 5.9M subscribers on Facebook Messenger and 500K followers on Instagram. We also ran the nation‚Äôs largest GOTV campaign for Black Americans. In May 2020, we launched Black History Year, our critically acclaimed podcast, which has received over 3M downloads. In January 2022, we launched the pilot season of our finance podcast, Building Black Dollars. We‚Äôre at 17k downloads already. As we continue building our podcasting network, many more shows that we produce will serve our wide listenership.


What We‚Äôre Looking For

We‚Äòre hiring an experienced, motivated, and entrepreneurial driven leader to be our Chief of Staff. The Chief of Staff will report directly to the Chief Executive Officer and will work closely with him to optimize his effectiveness, serving as a thought partner and trusted advisor and will lead the Executive Office team. This role will interface regularly with C-Suite leadership, but will not be a member of the C-Suite or hold operational responsibilities across the entire org. The ideal candidate is someone who is looking to provide strategic and program management support at the executive level. The Chief of Staff will support and manage the implementation of the Chief Executive Officer‚Äôs strategic priorities; manage and prioritize the workflow of the Chief Executive Officer's office; advance transparency, accessibility, inclusion, and a mission-centric focus through internal communications and collaboration. The Chief of Staff will also manage engagement with the organization‚Äôs Board of Directors and handle highly sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion.



What You‚Äôll Be Doing
  • Serve as a thought partner and strategic advisor to the Chief Executive Officer, especially as it relates to implementing his executive priorities;
  • Develop systems and processes to maximize the Chief Executive Officer‚Äôs time and effectiveness;
  • Coordinate efficient, effective cross-organizational collaboration and decision-making to ensure that involvement of the Chief Executive Officer is strategic and occurs at the right time;
  • Develop systems and processes to ensure that the Chief Executive Officer is well-informed of internal activities and external affairs, supporting his critical role in ‚Äúconnecting-the-dots‚Äù both internally and externally to support the mission and impact of the organization;
  • Attend meetings with the Chief Executive Officer, ensuring in advance that meeting objectives and agendas are clear and following up on action items and, as appropriate, stand in for Chief Executive Officer as appropriate;
  • Manage the Executive Team meeting agendas, focusing leaders on the Chief Executive Officer‚Äôs priorities and objectives for the organization, as well as those issues that cut across functions and programs to serve the organization‚Äôs mission and increase impact;
  • Lead and manage projects, including special projects, that require interdepartmental collaboration across the organization‚Äôs functional areas;
  • Lead internal communications and develop processes that reliably relay information and solicit feedback in a way that models inclusivity, transparency, efficiency, and accountability; develop and develop a comprehensive calendar of internal communications;
  • Manage engagement with the Board of Directors including, but not limited to, planning regular Board meetings and governance committee meetings; preparing and distributing Board meeting agendas, reports and supporting materials, and oversee communication with Board members to support the Board‚Äôs effectiveness;
  • Manage the work of the Executive Office, including the work of executive assistant(s)
  • Lead Executive Office team in setting their own priorities, improvement agenda, and workplan for each quarter

Requirements

Skills + Experience
  • Five to Ten years of demonstrated success in leadership, managerial, problem-solving, strategic planning, and implementation with solid business acumen
  • An avid reader who enjoys learning and applying that knowledge to their work.
  • Demonstrated experience performing research on a wide range of topics and synthesizing findings in a comprehensive but digestible format.
  • A proactive quick study with exceptional judgment as well as interpersonal and project management skills suited for a fast-paced organization.
  • Must have a demonstrated commitment to the organization‚Äôs mission and values.
  • An astute observer of organizational dynamics, a sophisticated purveyor of positive organizational culture, a proactive, skilled communicator able to establish and maintain strong relationships and have a zest for collaboration.
This Would Put You Over The Top
  • Demonstrated knowledge of how to use civic engagement and narrative change to advance Black liberation.
  • Experience in nonprofit or private media
  • Understands that this work is in service of the organization and the people who do the work of the organization
  • Familiarity with G-Suite, Slack, Trello, and/or other online productivity tools

Benefits

What We Offer Our Team
  • Whether you love your couch or your desk, it doesn‚Äôt matter. We‚Äôre 100% Remote!
  • 100% employer paid medical, dental and vision insurances
  • Retirement savings account (401K) with tiered matching contributions
  • Three weeks‚Äô (15 PTO days) paid vacation in the first year of service; four weeks (20 PTO days) in subsequent years. Ten (10) Sick days and 3 Floating Holidays every year.
  • Eight (8) Paid Holidays including Juneteenth, as well as a Winter holiday for the last week of the year
  • Annual taxable work-from-home stipend ($4,800)
  • Annual professional development budget ($1,750 of which $500 can roll over each year)
  • School loan repayment assistance support up to $200 monthly for undergraduate loans or up to $300 for graduate loans
  • Parental Leave during new child‚Äôs first year

Let‚Äôs Talk About The Salary
  • The salary range for this position is $103,272 - $166,138.

results.title: VP Engineering
results.description:
Over the last ten years, SaaS has changed the way we work ‚Äî for the better. Slack instead of email. Miro instead of sticky notes. Airtable instead of Excel. SaaS is helping tech companies move so much faster, but it‚Äôs also introducing a new surface area of risk they‚Äôve never seen before. The risk of leaking sensitive data. As a result, companies are faced with answering the difficult question of how to manage compounding security risks as they grow without introducing more red tape that slows their team members down.

At Metomic, we help tech companies save time & reduce costs by minimising their sensitive data footprint in cloud applications like Slack, Google Drive and Zendesk.

Our technology includes native integrations with dozens of cloud apps, AI to detect thousands of sensitive data types, and advanced functionality to manipulate data at scale (redaction, retention, access controls, etc). All from one place. This liberates tech companies to make full use of their favourite SaaS apps as they grow, whilst Metomic takes care of all the security risks behind the scenes.

After launching our product in April 2021, we now count some of the world‚Äôs most innovative companies as customers, such as Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent, Travelperk and Jumio. Our revenue is growing quickly and we‚Äôre backed by some great investors like Connect (investors in CityMapper, Typeform, Marvel), LocalGlobe (Improbable, Figma, Zego) and RFC (Hopin, Clubhouse, On Deck, etc).

¬†

Engineering Team

As we continue to change the way companies deal with their sensitive data, our Engineering Team (currently 8 strong) is growing and we‚Äôre looking to welcome Software Engineers, either back-end or full-stack, to our team to be part of this journey.

Some of the areas you may be working on: Our sensitive data and classification engine, building systems to allow us to process billions of messages a day, data ingest pipelines, sensitive data remediation system, risk identification and ranking engines and alerting systems.

Our back-end services are written in Typescript and make extensive use of Kafka, GraphQL and Postgres. Our front-end is written in React/TypeScript. Our house style is grounded in functional programming principles. We use AWS ECS Fargate via github actions and Terraform to deploy to production multiple times a day.

What you'll be doing

  • Scaling Engineering - You will scale our Engineering function, providing technical, people and process leadership as we embark on a hyper-growth journey.
  • People Leadership - Hire, onboard, develop, coach and motivate a team of Engineers. We‚Äôre currently 8 strong and at the foot of a period of significant growth, so will be investing heavily in talent, culture, tools and ways of working to set the team up for success.
  • Tech Strategy & Ways of Working - Partner with Sales and Product to align our vision, commercial strategy and tech strategy, and ensure delivery against the roadmap.
  • Building for tomorrow - We‚Äôve had a serious impact in a short space of time, particularly within FinTech, InsurTech and HealthTech scaleups experiencing hypergrowth. But we know Metomic has a home within the security stack of every company in the world that has sensitive data in cloud applications. This means our eyes will turn to how we scale our codebase, architecture, security and engineering processes to provide the best experience possible to larger and more complex enterprise customers. Excited yet? üòè
  • Delivering an incredible customer experience Roll up your sleeves and get stuck in alongside the team to solve complex technical challenges and ensure our customers have the best experience possible with our platform.

Requirements

  • A seasoned, inclusive and passionate people leader - You‚Äôll have breadth in your leadership style and know when to be a coach, an amplifier, an un-blocker, a sounding board, or deliver a difficult message. You‚Äôve grown teams to become a ‚Äòmanager of managers‚Äô and seen first-hand the opportunities and challenges that come with growing quickly.
  • A credible and experienced software engineer - We have a strong and autonomous engineering culture, so you‚Äôll be unafraid to get your hands dirty and feel comfortable leaning on your technical experience to make decisions.
  • You care deeply about the customer experience There is nothing more important at the end of the day. Front of mind for you will be ensuring clear alignment between the customer experience we‚Äôre creating and how we build and ship scalable software that delivers this.
  • You get a kick out of building something - Whilst we‚Äôre no stranger to solving problems and building features quickly to wow our customers, we‚Äôll ultimately look to you and your experience to ensure we have the infrastructure, processes, team structure and culture in place on which to build Metomic and ensure we are in the security stack of every company in the world using cloud applications.
¬†
Our recruitment process

We know your time is important and want to make sure our recruitment process provides both of us a really authentic and meaningful insight into what it would be like working together, so we‚Äôre planning on the following stages:

  • Intro Call (30 mins) This will focus on your motivations and interests, your journey to date and some of the experiences you‚Äôve had, along with a chance to share more about Metomic and the Engineering Team.
  • Engineering & Product Interview (1 hour) This will focus on your technical experience, decision-making and alignment of tech strategy with product strategy
  • Leadership Interview (1 hour) This will focus on your experience building and scaling engineering teams, your people leadership and your cultural contribution.
  • Meet the team (4 x 30 mins) - We also think it‚Äôs important you have a chance to meet your potential future teammates to get a broader perspective on Metomic.

Benefits

Compensation
  • Our range is ¬£130-150k base, but we know there's a broad range of compensation in the market for this sort of role. So if you're outside of this but feel it's a perfect fit, let's talk about that in our intro call.
  • Our success is your success, so you‚Äôll receive a sizeable equity package (under our tax-efficient EMI options scheme) as part of our annual grant process.
Life as a Metonaut üë©‚ÄçüöÄ
  • üè° Remote Working - We‚Äôre remote-friendly and also have a co-working space for those who prefer that.

SlashData is the leading research company in the developer economy: We help the world understand developers and developers understand the world. We survey 40,000+ developers annually - across mobile, IoT, desktop, cloud, AR/VR, web, games, data science, and machine learning - to help clients such as Microsoft, Facebook, Google and Amazon understand who developers are, what tools they love or hate and where they are going next.

We‚Äôre now looking for a full-time Data Analyst to help drive insights out of a wealth of data points relating to developer activity. You‚Äôll be working based anywhere in Europe / Greece, working remotely.

Requirements

Who we're are looking for

We are looking for a Data Analyst with at least 3 years of experience in data analysis to join our fast-growing company with the ability to undertake many high-profile data analysis projects.

You will be naturally curious and inquisitive and demonstrate a real passion for data and analytics, have an eye for detail and the aptitude to learn new technologies and skills.

What you'll be doing

  • A passion for technology, and an understanding of how it‚Äôs impacting people‚Äôs lives.

Key success metrics

You will be successful in the role if in the first 6 months you have:

  • Delivered at least 12 sets of data tables and/or graphs in response to client requests.

results.title: Software Engineer
results.description:
Over the last ten years, SaaS has changed the way we work ‚Äî for the better. Slack instead of email. Miro instead of sticky notes. Airtable instead of Excel. SaaS is helping tech companies move so much faster, but it‚Äôs also introducing a new surface area of risk they‚Äôve never seen before. The risk of leaking sensitive data. As a result, companies are faced with answering the difficult question of how to manage compounding security risks as they grow without introducing more red tape that slows their team members down.

At Metomic, we help tech companies save time & reduce costs by minimising their sensitive data footprint in cloud applications like Slack, Google Drive and Zendesk.

Our technology includes native integrations with dozens of cloud apps, AI to detect thousands of sensitive data types, and advanced functionality to manipulate data at scale (redaction, retention, access controls, etc). All from one place. This liberates tech companies to make full use of their favourite SaaS apps as they grow, whilst Metomic takes care of all the security risks behind the scenes.

After launching our product in April 2021, we now count some of the world‚Äôs most innovative companies as customers, such as Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent, Travelperk and Jumio. Our revenue is growing quickly and we‚Äôre backed by some great investors like Connect (investors in CityMapper, Typeform, Marvel), LocalGlobe (Improbable, Figma, Zego) and RFC (Hopin, Clubhouse, On Deck, etc).

¬†

Engineering Team

As we continue to change the way companies deal with their sensitive data, our Engineering Team (currently 8 strong) is growing and we‚Äôre looking to welcome Software Engineers, either back-end or full-stack, to our team to be part of this journey.

Some of the areas you may be working on: Our sensitive data and classification engine, building systems to allow us to process billions of messages a day, data ingest pipelines, sensitive data remediation system, risk identification and ranking engines and alerting systems.

Our back-end services are written in Typescript and make extensive use of Kafka, GraphQL and Postgres. Our front-end is written in React/TypeScript. Our house style is grounded in functional programming principles. We use AWS ECS Fargate via github actions and Terraform to deploy to production multiple times a day.

Requirements

  • Product-minded and pragmatic engineers - Front of mind for you is thinking through what the best solution is for the problem the customer is facing. You‚Äôll be given a lot of autonomy to explore solutions from what we build, how it‚Äôs designed and what technologies we use.
  • Problem-solvers - We‚Äôre facing a lot of previously uncharted territory and with that a set of new and unseen challenges. You‚Äôre not one to shy away from tackling these sorts of problems. You‚Äôll think through not just how to solve a problem, but what caused the problem in the first place and how we can make improvements to prevent similar problems in the future.
  • One eye on now, one eye on what‚Äôs next - Our engineers have a passion for bringing to life distributed systems and scalable and robust architectures. You‚Äôll have a huge role in coming up with how the system will evolve from an architecture and engineering standpoint.
  • Culture contributors - We‚Äôre a small, close-knit team and recognise the importance of our culture as we continue to grow. You‚Äôll be pivotal in helping shape the early stages and building a team platform that we can grow from.
¬†
Our recruitment process

We know your time is important and want to make sure our recruitment process provides both of us a really authentic and meaningful insight into what it would be like working together, so we‚Äôre planning on the following stages:

  1. Intro Call (30 mins) This will focus on your motivations and interests, your journey to date and some of the experiences you‚Äôve had, along with a chance to share more about Metomic and the Engineering Team.
  2. Technical Interview (1 hour) - You will pair with one of our Software Engineers to work through a Search API challenge. This will also involve some discussion about your experience and a chance to ask questions about our Engineering team and challenges.
  3. Whiteboard Interview (1 hour) - You will meet 1-2 other members of the Engineering team and work together in a whiteboard systems design activity
  4. [Optional] Team Interview (30 mins) - Depending on how many of the team you have met during the two technical interviews, we may invite you to meet one of our Lead Engineers or the CTO and discuss in more detail the opportunity at Metomic and any questions on your mind.

Compensation

  • Our success is your success, so you‚Äôll receive equity (under our tax-efficient EMI options scheme) as part of our annual grant process.
